verbose_text: Contradicting these results is a study by Su et al., which suggests that both gene copies of iglA, iglB, or iglC are required for full virulence of LVS in a mouse model of respiratory tularemia and a study by Maier et al., demonstrating that HimarFT insertion mutants in one of the iglB, iglC, or iglD loci result in only partial loss of J774 monolayer integrity upon infection, in contrast to when parental LVS was used.
